ThingDef.label: salmon
ThingDef.description: A fish known for its rich pink flesh. Salmon spend portions of their life in both freshwater and saltwater.

ThingDef.label: bass
ThingDef.description: A common freshwater fish known for its aggression and mild taste.

ThingDef.label: tilapia
ThingDef.description: Hardy freshwater fish, common in warm rivers and lakes.

ThingDef.label: cod
ThingDef.description: A cold water fish recognizable for its distinct whisker-like organ on the lower jaw.

ThingDef.label: bluefish
ThingDef.description: A common fish recognizable by its forked tail. Bluefish are extensively farmed on some urbworlds.

ThingDef.label: guppy
ThingDef.description: A small, colorful freshwater fish. While edible, guppies are rarely eaten due to their small size and low nutrition value. Instead, guppies are usually sold for their vibrant scales.

ThingDef.label: frostfish
ThingDef.description: Large bioengineered fish created for long-distance shipping. They taste great even after being frozen solid for years. Their large size means they provide more nutrition than most fish.

ThingDef.label: catfish
ThingDef.description: A large freshwater fish with distinct whisker-like organs. Their large size means they provide more nutrition than most fish.

ThingDef.label: piranha
ThingDef.description: A freshwater fish with sharp teeth and powerful jaws. While aggressive, they pose little actual danger to humans. They're commonly sought by trophy hunters, meaning they can fetch a fair price.

ThingDef.label: dogfish
ThingDef.description: A small species of shark. Their large size means they provide more nutrition than most fish. However, some complain they have an unpleasant aftertaste.

ThingDef.label: marlin
ThingDef.description: Large oceanic fish with spear-like snouts usually found in temperate and tropical waters. Their large size means they provide more nutrition than most fish.

ThingDef.label: tuna
ThingDef.description: Large migratory fish that inhabit warm seas. Their large size means they provide more nutrition than most fish.

ThingDef.label: flounder
ThingDef.description: Large flatfish that are commonly found in coastal water. They feed in muddy areas of the ocean floor.

ThingDef.label: toxfish
ThingDef.description: A fish that has been mutated by polluted water. When eaten raw, it has a high chance of food poisoning. It can be safely used to cook a meal but provides little nutrition.
